sen.j: 菅沼 定昭（すがぬま さだあきら）は、丹波亀山藩の第2代藩主。
sen.e: Sadaakira SUGANUMA was the second lord of the Kameyama Domain in Tanba Province.
Sadaakira SUGANUMA was the second lord of the Kameyama Domain in Tanba Province.
Sadaakira SUGANUMA was the second lord of the Kameyama Domain in Tanba Province.

sen.j: 寛永2年（1625年）、丹波亀山藩の初代藩主（当時は近江国膳所藩主）・菅沼定芳の第3子、長男として膳所で生まれる。
sen.e: In 1625, he was born in Zeze as the third child and oldest son of Sadayoshi SUGANUMA, the first lord of the Kameyama Domain in Tanba Province (in those days, the lord of the Zeze Domain in Omi Province).

In 1625, he was born in Zeze as the third child and oldest son of Sadayoshi SUGANUMA, the first lord of the Kameyama Domain in Tanba Province (in those days, the lord of the Zeze Domain in Omi Province).

In 1625, he was born in Zeze as the third child and oldest son of Sadayoshi SUGANUMA, the first lord of the Kameyama Domain in Tanba Province (in those days, the lord of the Zeze Domain in Omi Province).

sen.j: 嫡出の姉2人とは違い、庶出であった。
sen.e: In contrary to his two older sisters, who were legitimate children, he was an illegitimate child.
In contrary to his two older sisters, who were legitimate children, he was an illegitimate child.
In contrary to his two older sisters, who were legitimate children, he was an illegitimate child.

sen.j: 寛永17年（1640年）、従五位下・左近将監に叙位・任官される。
sen.e: In 1640, he was conferred and appointed Jugoinoge Sakon no shogen (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade, Lieutenant the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).
In 1640, he was conferred and appointed Jugoinoge Sakon no shogen (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade, Lieutenant the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).
In 1640, he was conferred and appointed Jugoinoge Sakon no shogen (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade, Lieutenant the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).

sen.j: 寛永20年（1643年）、父の死去により家督を継いで亀山藩の第2代藩主となる。
sen.e: In 1643, he succeeded his father as a head of the family and became the second lord of the Kameyama Domain.
In 1643, he succeeded his father as a head of the family and became the second lord of the Kameyama Domain.
In 1643, he succeeded his father as a head of the family and became the second lord of the Kameyama Domain.

sen.j: このとき、異母弟・菅沼定実へ2000石、異母（菅沼定実の母とも異なる）弟・菅沼定賞へは1100石の知行地を分与し、4万1100石から3万8000石にまで直轄領が減った。
sen.e: At this time, he distributed a chigyo-chi (a territory) of 2,000 koku to Sadazane SUGANUMA, a younger paternal half-brother, and 1,100 koku to Sadayoshi SUGANUMA, a younger paternal half-brother (whose mother was different from the one of Sadazane SUGANUMA); his direct control territory decreased from 41,100 koku to 38,000 koku.

At this time, he distributed a chigyo-chi (a territory) of 2,000 koku to Sadazane SUGANUMA, a younger paternal half-brother, and 1,100 koku to Sadayoshi SUGANUMA, a younger paternal half-brother (whose mother was different from the one of Sadazane SUGANUMA); his direct control territory decreased from 41,100 koku to 38,000 koku.

At this time, he distributed a chigyo-chi (a territory) of 2,000 koku to Sadazane SUGANUMA, a younger paternal half-brother, and 1,100 koku to Sadayoshi SUGANUMA, a younger paternal half-brother (whose mother was different from the one of Sadazane SUGANUMA); his direct control territory decreased from 41,100 koku to 38,000 koku.

sen.j: なお同母弟の定房は、叔父・定官（田中吉官）の婿養嗣子に貰われた。
sen.e: Also, his younger brother Sadafusa became the heir (who was adopted by his wife's family) of his uncle Sadasuke (Yoshisuke TANAKA).
Also, his younger brother Sadafusa became the heir (who was adopted by his wife's family) of his uncle Sadasuke (Yoshisuke TANAKA).
Also, his younger brother Sadafusa became the heir (who was adopted by his wife's family) of his uncle Sadasuke (Yoshisuke TANAKA).

sen.j: 正保4年（1647年）9月21日、丹波亀山にて死去。
sen.e: On October 18, 1647, he died in Tanba Kameyama.
On October 18, 1647, he died in Tanba Kameyama.
On October 18, 1647, he died in Tanba Kameyama.
He died at the age of 23.
He died at the age of 23.
He died at the age of 23.

sen.j: 正室がまだ居なかった時期での不幸であったようだ。
sen.e: It was unfortunate that he died even before he could find his lawful wife.
It was unfortunate that he died even before he could find his lawful wife.
It was unfortunate that he died even before he could find his lawful wife.

sen.j: 側妾も確認されておらず、嗣子も無いために、菅沼氏は無嗣改易となった。
sen.e: Because there is no record mentioning that he had either mistresses or heirs, the Suganuma clan was ceased to change the rank for the extinction of family line.
Because there is no record mentioning that he had either mistresses or heirs, the Suganuma clan was ceased to change the rank for the extinction of family line.
Because there is no record mentioning that he had either mistresses or heirs, the Suganuma clan was ceased to change the rank for the extinction of family line.

sen.j: しかし、翌年閏正月、弟の菅沼定実に1万石が与えられに名跡相続を許された。
sen.e: However, in an intercalary month of February the following year, his brother Sadazane SUGANUMA was given 10,000 koku and allowed for the succession of family name.
sen.cmt: 閏正月とは正月の次に追加された月であることから、旧暦正月はグレゴリオ暦では2月頃なので訳文のようにしました。
sen.e: However, in an intercalary month of February the following year, his brother Sadazane SUGANUMA was given 10,000 koku and allowed for the succession of family name.
However, in an intercalary month of February the following year, his brother Sadazane SUGANUMA was given 10,000 koku and allowed for the succession of family name.

sen.j: 自身は7000石（交代寄合）を拝領し、弟菅沼定賞に3000石を分与。
sen.e: Sadazane himself received 7,000 koku (alternate yoriai, a family status of samurai warriors in the Edo period) and distributed 3,000 koku to his brother Sadayoshi SUGANUMA.
Sadazane himself received 7,000 koku (alternate yoriai, a family status of samurai warriors in the Edo period) and distributed 3,000 koku to his brother Sadayoshi SUGANUMA.
Sadazane himself received 7,000 koku (alternate yoriai, a family status of samurai warriors in the Edo period) and distributed 3,000 koku to his brother Sadayoshi SUGANUMA.

sen.j: 子孫は両系統とも存続している。
sen.e: Their descendants in both family lines are still living.
Their descendants in both family lines are still living.
Their descendants in both family lines are still living.

sen.j: なお、定昭より分与された知行地は収公された。
sen.e: Also, the territory distributed by Sadaakira was confiscated.
Also, the territory distributed by Sadaakira was confiscated.
Also, the territory distributed by Sadaakira was confiscated.
